page.title: 16Life at New Haldon Farm
page.content: I live at New Haldon Farm and it is quite big being 71 acres including woodland. We are trying to buy more land otherwise we are going to be overloaded with sheep. We have about 250 sheep. We lamb in a big shed. For indoor lambing we bring the sheep in during November and we lamb in December. This is our first batch. Our second batch is in March. We always shear our sheep in the winter. There is a disease called ecolia. It is a disease which lambs get if you don't give them pills when they are born. My Mum and I know when they have got it when they start frothing at the mouth and get stiff. You cannot save them at all. We have cows and we rear calves from them. By Kim Loosemore, age 10
